title.value: Optimization of the location and design of urban green spaces
title.justification: The paper provided discusses the optimization strategies for urban green spaces.
title.quote: Optimization of the location and design of urban green spaces

extractions.description: The paper presents an optimization model to assist in the planning of urban green spaces with a focus on parks. It discusses a two-stage decision process for optimizing the city-budget allocation to neighborhoods and the optimal location and design of parks within neighborhoods. The model includes considerations of equity and environmental justice, and it incorporates a clustering method to enhance computational efficiency. The methodology is applied to the city of Montreal as a case study.

type.justification: The paper presents a model and methodology for optimization in urban planning rather than conducting empirical experiments.
type.quote: we present a two-stage fair facility location and design model, which serves as a template model to assist public decision-makers

name.justification: The paper applies tools from operations research to urban green space planning, with a focus on optimization models.
name.quote: we showcase the application of classic tools from Operations Research to assist decision-makers

name.justification: The paper involves planning urban green spaces and optimizing their location and design.
name.quote: to assist public decision-makers at the city-level for the planning of urban green spaces

name.justification: The paper considers equity and environmental justice in the allocation of city budgets for green spaces.
name.quote: we are particularly concerned with equity and environmental justice

name.justification: A significant part of the paper focuses on developing and applying optimization models.
name.quote: optimization model is about the optimal city-budget allocation to neighborhoods...to maximize the total expected probability of individuals visiting parks

name.justification: The paper explicitly discusses using a Spatial Interaction Model to assess users’ behavior in urban green spaces.
name.quote: focused on an advanced assessment of users’ behavior through a spatial interaction model

is_contributed.justification: The paper proposes using the Spatial Interaction Model within its optimization framework.
is_contributed.quote: we modify the standard competitive facility location problem formulation to our context of public facilities provision

is_executed.justification: There is no indication that the Spatial Interaction Model was executed on any specific hardware in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Our work focuses on green spaces as parks. Our modeling strategy is based on a two-stage decision process.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not compare the Spatial Interaction Model numerically to other models.
is_compared.quote: we use utilities instead of distances to model the preferences of the population

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper does not provide a direct reference to another paper specifically about the Spatial Interaction Model.
